gurmukhi: ਅਨੰਤ ਘੋਰ ਸਾਵਣੀ ਦੁਰੰਤ ਜਯੋ ੳੁਠੀ ਘਟਾ ॥ ਸੁ ਸੋਭ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਨਚੈ ਸੁ ਛੀਨ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਕੀ ਛਟਾ ॥੩੯॥
transliteration: Anant Thor Saavanidurant Jyo Outhighataa|| Su Sobh Soormaa Nachai Su Chheen Chhatra Kichhataa||39||
translation: They gathered quickly like the rising and thundering clouds of Sawan and gathering the glory of heaven in themselves, began to dance, being highly intoxicated.39.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਪਾੲਿ ਖੱਗ ਪਾਣ ਮੋ ਤ੍ਰਪਾੲਿ ਤਾਜੀਯਨ ਤਹਾਂ ॥ ਜੁਅਾਨ ਅਾਨਕੈ ਪਰੇ ਸੁ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਠਾਢਬੋ ਜਹਾਂ ॥
transliteration: Ki Paae Khagg Paan Mo Trapaae Taajeeyan Tahaan|| Juaan Aankai Dare Su Rudra Thaadhho Jahaan||
translation: Holding their swords in their hands and galloping their horses, the mighty youthful warriors stopped there, where Rudra was standing.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਅੰਤ ਬਾਣ ਸੈਹਥੀ ਪ੍ਹਾਰ ਅਾਨਕੇ ਕਰੈਂ ॥ ਧਕੇਲ ਰੇਲ ਲੈ ਚਲੈ ਪਛੇਲ ਪਾਵ ਨਾ ਟਰੈਂ ॥੪੦॥
transliteration: Beant Baan Saihathiprahaar Aankaa Darain || Dhakel Rel Lai Chalai Pachhel Paav Naa Darain||40||
translation: The brave fighters began to inflict blows with many types of arrows and weapons and forcibly moved forward, without retracing their steps.40.

gurmukhi: ਸੜੱਕ ਸੂਲ ਸੈਹਥੀ ਤੜੱਕ ਤੇਗ ਤੀਰਯੰ ॥ ਬਬੱਕ ਬਾਘ ਜਯੋਂ ਬਲੀ ਭਭੱਕ ਘਾੲਿ ਬੀਰਯੰ ॥
transliteration: Sadakk Sool Saihathitadakk Teg Teerayan|| Bbakk Baagh Jyon Balibhabbakk Ghaae Beerayan||
translation: The clattering of daggers and sword is being heard; the warriors are wounding one another, roaring like lions.

gurmukhi: ਅਘਾੲਿ ਘਾੲਿਕੈ ਗਿਰੇ ਪਛੇਲ ਪਾਵ ਨਾ ਟਰੇ ॥ ਸੁ ਬੀਨ ਬੀਨ ਅੱਛਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ਦੀਨ ਹੁਅੈ ਬਰੇ ॥੪੧॥
transliteration: Aghaae Ghaaekai Gire Pachhel Paav Naa Dare|| Su Been Been Achchhre Prabeen Deen Huai Dare||41||
translation: On getting wounded the warriors are falling down, but are not retracing their steps.41.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਜੂਝ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਸਭ ਸਾਥਾ ॥ ਰਹਿ ਗਯੋ ਦੱਛ ਅਕੇਲ ਅਨਾਥਾ ॥
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Joojh Giryo Sabh Saathaa|| Raih Gyo Dachchh Akel Anaathaa||
translation: In this way, all his companions fell down and Daksha was only left behind.

gurmukhi: ਬਚੇ ਬੀਰ ਤੇ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਬੁਲਾੲਿਸ ॥ ਪਹਰ ਕਵਚ ਦੁੰਦਭੀ ਬਜਾੲਿਸ ॥੪੨॥
transliteration: Bache Beer Te Bahur(i) Bulaais|| Pahar Kavach Doundabhibajaais||42||
translation: He called again his remaining fighters and wearing his armour, he caused the resounding of the musical instrument.42.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਨ ਚਲਾ ਜੁੱਧ ਕਹ ਰਾਜਾ ॥ ਜੋਰ ਕਰੋਰ ਅਯੋਧਨ ਸਾਜਾ ॥
transliteration: Aapan Chalaa Juddh Kah Raajaa|| Jor Daror Ayodhan Saajaa||
translation: The king Daksha, moved forward, with the strength of the innumerable warriors.

gurmukhi: ਛੂਟਤ ਬਾਣ ਕਮਾਣ ਅਪਾਰਾ ॥ ਜਨੁ ਦਿਨ ਤੇ ਹੁਅੈ ਗਯੋ ਅੰਧਾਰਾ ॥੪੩॥
transliteration: Chhoutat Baan Kamaan Apaaraa|| Jan(u) Din Te Huai Gado Andhaaraa||43||
translation: Innumerable arrows were discharged from his bow and such a scene was crated that there was darkness during the day.43.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਤ ਪਰੇਤ ਮਸਾਣ ਹਕਾਰੇ ॥ ਦੁਹੂੰ ਓਰ ਡੳੁਰੂ ਡਮਕਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Bhoot Daret Masaan Hakdare|| Duhoon Or Dauroo Damkdare||
translation: The ghosts and friends began to shout and the tabors resounded from both the sides.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ਘੋਰ ਮੱਚਯੋ ਸੰਗ੍ਰਾਮਾ ॥ ਜੈਸਕ ਲੰਕ ਰਾਵਣ ਅਰੁ ਰਾਮਾ ॥੪੪॥
transliteration: Mahaan Ghor Machchyo Sanraamaa|| Jaisak Lank Raavan Ar(u) Raamaa||44||
translation: A fierce fighting ensued and it appeared that the war was going on between Rama and Ravana in Sri Lanka.44.
